body: After a recent pull, spack fails to use gcc.  It either claims I'm on an operating system I'm not on (which is interesting in and of itself) or attempts to load a module that doesn't exist.  The latter problem appears to be caused by this change: https://github.com/LLNL/spack/blame/3f90fee614cf44f31344de3443f2a2e63c6d9fb4/lib/spack/spack/compilers/gcc.py#L52
title: recent update causes gcc to be unusable
